Description: Head of Ptolemy I Soter, diademed, right.
Eagle standing left on thunderbolt, wings open.
State: Associated with: Kingdom of Egypt Ancient Greece and Rome: Kingdom of Egypt
Bibliographic references: BMC Greek (Ptolemies) / Catalogue of Greek coins: the Ptolemies, kings of Egypt (69, p.21)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Ptolemy I Soter I
Acquisition notes: This is the historic catalogue of Greek coins acquired before 1837 made by Edward Hawkins, then Keeper of the Department of Antiquities. It does not include the collections previously acquired from Payne Knight (1824), George III (1825), Burrell (1832), and Hine (1825), or the coins included in Taylor Combe's 1814 catalogue.
